image.altText: A line of people at an airport.

props.synopsis: The cancellation of almost 100 Jetstar flights due to a software issue with Airbus A320 planes has left passengers stranded across Australia, with every major domestic airport affected.

title.children: Chaos as 90 Jetstar flights cancelled due to A320 plane recall

image.altText: A digitally blended composite image comprised of people and the RBA

props.synopsis: Hotter-than-expected inflation figures have caught most economists and policy makers off guard. The ongoing price pressures in the economy open the door for an RBA interest rate hike in 2026.

title.children: The RBA's likely next interest rate move has surprised just about everyone

image.altText: A jumping castle flipped on the ground

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a property in Bradfield following reports a jumping castle had flown into the air with people onboard.

title.children: Five children injured after jumping castle flies into air in Sydney's west

image.altText: Four national guard members patrol outside the Lincoln memorial.

props.synopsis: Less than 24 hours after the shooting, Trump officials began ordering widespread reviews of immigration policies.

title.children: US halts all asylum claims following shooting of two National Guard troops

image.altText: Map of Sunda and Sahul, with arrows showing potential migration routes.

props.synopsis: A new genetic study has found Indigenous Australians travelled over two distinct routes, and 100 kilometres of open water, to reach the ancient landmass that would become Australia 60,000 to 65,000 years ago.

title.children: DNA study provides 'almost perfect correlation' for first Australians' arrival

image.altText: A young girl walks across granite rocks covered in orange algae by the beach.

props.synopsis: Twenty years ago, Cape Barren Island was handed back to its traditional owners. Today's children are proof of the life-changing power of that act.

title.children: From $50 rentals to burying the dead, this island governs itself

image.altText: Bob Starkie

props.synopsis: A statement released on Skyhooks' official Facebook page announced his passing this morning.

title.children: Skyhooks guitarist Bob Starkie dies aged 73 after battle with cancer

image.altText: Ben Stokes leads England off Perth Stadium after its loss to Australia in first Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: Captain Ben Stokes responds to England's critics in the wake of the defeat to Australia in the first Test, maintaining his squad will not step back from its aggressive approach.

title.children: England cricketers happy to be labelled 'rubbish' but not 'arrogant'

image.altText: Blue Wiggle Anthony dancing in the background with musician Keli Holiday at the front

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for the group says the band "does not condone" the use of drugs after a since-deleted video promoting Keli Holiday's single, Ecstasy, appeared on social media.

title.children: Wiggles issue statement after appearing in Keli Holiday Ecstasy video

image.altText: A student at Charles Darwin University heads to a 2016 graduation ceremony.

props.synopsis: The saddest aspect of all this that a generation of boys may feel compelled to suppress the ordinary the joy of celebrating another's success.

title.children: Angry, panicked men have built themselves a joyless, exhausting prison

image.altText: A man takes a selfie in a bush setting with a plant in front of his face where the black pod-like flowers are spread out.

props.synopsis: A species of Australian native plant related to kangaroo paws has been named after the humble rotary clothesline.

title.children: 'Looked like a Hills hoist': Australian native plant named for backyard icon

image.altText: Photo illustration shows a downward trending line chart with emissions from a fossil fuel plant and a forest on either side.

props.synopsis: Australia's emissions had the biggest drop ever this year outside the artificial kink in the curve during COVID-19 shutdowns, but there's still a lot of work to do.

title.children: Record drop for Australia's emissions: What's working and what isn't?

image.altText: Lana has bright blonde hair and sits on a black couhc looking out the window with ligth falling on her face.

props.synopsis: As more people turn towards cosmetic injectable "journeys", Lana is sounding the alarm about the risks of developing long-term side effects.

title.children: Concern filler doesn't break down even with hyaluronidase dissolver

image.altText: A photo of people holding up signs and protesting in a crowd, with Aboriginal symbols and colours

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man has been released from custody after police withdrew charges against him.

title.children: Man released from custody after police withdraw murder charges

image.altText: Two people outside a Bedford site.

props.synopsis: Former Bedford staff have said they are owed millions of dollars in entitlements after they were made redundant when the disability employment provider entered voluntary administration earlier this year.

title.children: Terminated Bedford staff in limbo, with millions owed in entitlements

image.altText: Two halves of a mango on a chopping board.

props.synopsis: What's the difference between a big R2E2, a delicate Honey Gold, and an iconic Kensington Pride? Find out before biting into a mango this season.

title.children: Fancy a sweet, juicy mango? Here's all you need to know about them

image.altText: Usman Khawaja leans back

props.synopsis: Usman Khawaja may face a sanction for labelling the first Ashes Test surface a "piece of shit", with Cricket Australia understood to be disappointed by the remarks.

title.children: Cricket Australia to speak with Khawaja over Perth pitch criticism

image.altText: McLaren Formula 1 driver smiles for the camera and gives a thumbs up after Qatar sprint qualifying.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri returns to form by qualifying fastest for the F1 sprint in Qatar, as he launches an unlikely bid to catch McLaren teammate and world championship leader Lando Norris.

title.children: 'Nice to be back' on top, Piastri says as he claims Qatar sprint pole

image.altText: Breanna Koenen and Jasmine Garner hold the premiership cup

props.synopsis: Wondering what time the AFLW grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

title.children: Everything you need to know ahead of tonight's AFLW grand final

image.altText: Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: Something has now been unleashed in Europe which is going to be hard to put back in the bottle.

title.children: Europe doesn't find talk of Russian aggression as funny as Putin does

image.altText: A rescuer with an orange helmet walks through chest-deep floodwaters towards two men down a flooded street.

props.synopsis: Parts of South-East Asia have been hit with record levels of rain as a cyclone hits Sri Lanka, causing floods and landslides, as the system heads towards India.

title.children: South-East Asia floods kill hundreds as cyclone hits Sri Lanka

image.altText: Boy wearing hood and cap and hiking bag on top of a mountain.

props.synopsis: Four years after a 15-year-old boy died due to a nut allergy, a Victorian coroner is examining if the death was preventable and whether paramedics and doctors at the Box Hill Hospital provided appropriate care.

title.children: 'He deserved to live': Was Max's death from allergies preventable?

image.altText: A portrait of Niels Becker, showing him with short hair and a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: A Coroner has determined that Niels Gunther Becker, 39, who went missing at Mount Buller in 2019 is dead but that no third party was involved.

title.children: Coroner says Mount Buller hiker missing since 2019 is dead but no third party was involved

image.altText: A person looks through court documents

props.synopsis: Obtaining court transcripts can cost thousands of dollars for a single day of proceedings, but the documents can contain errors, missing text, and even wrong attribution, frustrating legal practitioners who say the flaws impede justice.

title.children: 'I'm deeply troubled': Lawyers call out erroneous court transcripts

image.altText: A chocolate and strawberry no bake cake with layers of cream in a glass baking dish. Sliced strawberries and biscuits on top

props.synopsis: Icebox cakes are retro no-bake desserts made by layering store-bought biscuits and whipped cream. A no-fuss option for summer celebrations, this one can be assembled in 10 minutes and made well ahead of time.

title.children: No-bake chocolate and strawberry cake is the ultimate make-ahead dessert

image.altText: A piggy bank, a toy home and a magnifying glass laid on a piece of floorplan

props.synopsis: We asked three financial experts about the up-front and ongoing costs of buying a home and for their tips on how to prepare for home ownership.

title.children: Think you're ready to own a home? Here are the costs to consider

image.altText: a man with grey hair and glasses speaks to reporters at a  press conference

props.synopsis: A Queensland government-ordered report on the use of puberty blockers and hormone therapies in the treatment of transgender adolescents is due on Sunday but might never be publicly released.

title.children: Queensland report on puberty blockers might not see the light of day

image.altText: murder victim Lilie James in a car wearing a yellow top smiles as she takes a selfie

props.synopsis: Experts on gendered violence have warned against the proliferation of everyday location sharing tools to control victim-survivors after NSW's top coroner found Paul Thijssen used them to track Lilie James before her murder.

title.children: Tools 'at tips of everybody's fingers' being abused by DV perpetrators

image.altText: A collage of images including missing boy Gus Lamont.

props.synopsis: The disappearance of Gus Lamont is one of those events that have a seismic impact on public consciousness: they distress, disturb, upset and unsettle. This week six mine shafts were searched, providing no further clues in the case.

title.children: Gus has been gone for 63 days, and multiple searches have yielded no clues

image.altText: An 80-year-old woman looking straight into the camera.

props.synopsis: Decades on from Australia's forced adoption era, just two states have set up a redress scheme for the mothers who were harmed. Survivors are calling for South Australia to take similar action — warning time is running out.

title.children: Jo had her baby 'ripped away' at birth — she's one of thousands across Australia

image.altText: a severe storm cell sweeps over brisbane

props.synopsis: An ongoing heatwave along Australia's eastern seaboard will fuel further extreme weather this weekend, and its longevity is now breaking long standing records.

title.children: Hottest spring on record for east coast as dangerous weekend storms return

image.altText: A young mum smiles wearing her daughter in a carry.

props.synopsis: When Ali Gossage gave birth a second time, she did not experience the constant joys of motherhood. Instead, she was sometimes filled with "terrifying" anger.

title.children: Mother urges others to reach out after terrifying postpartum 'blackout rage'

image.altText: A large pelican snaps its beak around another pelican's head.

props.synopsis: Locals say this cheeky pelican has a personality unlike any bird they have ever seen.

title.children: 'Naughty Boy' pelican munches on seagulls and plays dead for tourists

image.altText: Green and yellow parrot with blue wings in flight.

props.synopsis: Australia is the land of the parrot — few places in the world have such a dazzling array of colourful and clever members of the psittacine family.

title.children: Who's thriving? Who's barely surviving? A guide to Australia's native parrots
